    Use a Hugging Face pipeline or model_id to quickly predict on your inputs

    Source: R/inference.R
    hf_predict.Rd

    If a model_id is provided, the Inference API will be used to make the prediction. If you wish to download a pipeline rather than running your predictions through the Inference API, download the model first with the hf_load_pipeline() function.

    hf_predict(
  pipeline,
  inputs,
  parameters = NULL,
  use_gpu = FALSE,
  use_cache = FALSE,
  wait_for_model = FALSE,
  use_auth_token = NULL,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    pipeline

    Either a downloaded pipeline from the Hugging Face Hub (using hf_load_pipeline()) or a model_id.

    inputs

    The data to predict on.

    parameters

    Model parameters distinct to the model being used.

    use_gpu

    API Only - Whether to use GPU for inference.

    use_cache

    API Only - Whether to use cached inference results for previously seen inputs.

    wait_for_model

    API Only - Whether to wait for the model to be ready instead of receiving a 503 error after a certain amount of time.

    use_auth_token

    API Only - The token to use as HTTP bearer authorization for the Inference API. Defaults to HUGGING_FACE_HUB_TOKEN environment variable.

    ...

    sent to instantiation of model

    Value

    A Hugging Face model prediction.

    See also

    https://huggingface.co/docs/api-inference/index

    Contents

    Developed by Alex Farach, Sam Terfa, Jack Penzer.
